User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the AttendX system.

id.description: Unique member identifier for the user entity.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

role.description: The user's role in the system (Admin, Executive Member, General Member).

eventParticipationScore.description: A score representing the user's participation in events.

AttendanceSession.title: AttendanceSession
AttendanceSession.description: Represents an attendance session for a meeting, event, or workshop.

id.description: Unique identifier for the attendance session.

title.description: The title of the attendance session.

description.description: A description of the attendance session.

date.description: The date of the attendance session.

time.description: The time of the attendance session.

type.description: The type of attendance session (General Meeting, AGM, Event, Workshop).

attendanceCode.description: The unique attendance code for the session.

qrCodeURL.description: URL of the QR code image for the session.

AttendanceRecord.title: AttendanceRecord
AttendanceRecord.description: Represents a single attendance record for a user in a session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the attendance record.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the attendance was recorded.

geolocation.description: The geolocation of the user when they recorded attendance. Store as JSON string.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Only the user themselves can read/write their own profile. Includes standard user profile information (name, email, department, batch, photoURL).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Stores attendance session details.  Accessible to all users for viewing, but only admins can create, update, or delete sessions.

params.name: sessionId
params.description: The unique identifier of the attendance session.

definition.description: Stores attendance records for a specific session. Includes denormalized 'userId' for authorization independence. This allows verifying the user exists (via `request.auth.uid`) without needing to read the user's profile document. Includes timestamp and geolocation for attendance tracking.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure is designed to support the AttendX Attendance Management System. It prioritizes authorization independence, clarity, and scalability.  Users are stored in a top-level `users` collection. Admin status is handled via Firebase Custom Claims on the auth token, which is more secure and performant than a separate `roles_admin` collection. Attendance sessions are stored in a top-level `attendanceSessions` collection. Attendance records are stored in a subcollection of `attendanceSessions`, enabling efficient querying of attendance for a given session. 

Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. The `isAdmin()` function now checks `request.auth.token.admin`, which is fast and secure. The `AttendanceRecord` documents denormalize the `userId`, which enables security rules to validate the user without reading the full `User` document.

The structure supports the required QAPs. Private data (user profiles) are stored under `/users/{userId}`, ensuring path-based ownership. Admin access is controlled via custom claims.  Attendance sessions are public read, but write access is restricted to admins.
